input_text:
Job Title: Biomedical Equipment Tech I

Location: Morristown, NJ

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Job Description

Atlantic Health System is seeking a Biomedical Technician II that will be focusing on Initial installations of medical equipment and systems. This will be a local (between our Northern NJ medical facilities) traveling position.

Possesses understanding and skills related to general medical equipment systems and devicesPossesses understanding of medical PC and peripheralsSignificant working knowledge of physiology, anatomy and medical terminology with emphasis in clinical application and troubleshootingPossesses the ability to follow manufacturer's procedures for preventive maintenance inspection, scheduled maintenance, electrical safety inspections, and operation verification procedures on medical equipment including but not limited to physiologic monitors, infusion devices, defibrillators, ESUs and general medical equipmentRepair, install, and calibrate complex and intricate medical equipmentExhibits understanding and can demonstrate use of all required hand tools and test equipment for medical equipment, including but not limited to: digital multi meter, electrical safety analyzer, pressure measuring gauges, ESU analyzer, defibrillator tester, patient simulator and infusion pump testerInform supervisors of the status of repairs, scheduled inspections, unusual medical equipment situations, and any customer concernsWork with, document the activities of subcontractors, vendors, and outside service technicians to ensure proper service delivery and vendor documentationDevelop biomedical expertise through ongoing training and educationAssist with special projects as assignedExhibits understanding and can communicate the use of devices supportedCan provide support of non-high risk and basic support for high risk medical equipment for direct patient carePossesses understanding of the daily operations of the departments supported. (hospital, clinic, offsite locations, etc.)Possesses experience in their assigned clinical environmentPrepare to assume 24-hour on-call repair responsibilitiesCurrent understanding and use of Medical Equipment Management Plan (MEMP), The Joint Commission, NFPA and other regulatory agencies' standardsEnsure the accuracy and integrity of the equipment database to include the inventory, preventive maintenance schedules, nomenclature, and service historyEnsures service completed and documentation submitted is accurate, complete and timelyDemonstrate the ability to resolve complex service line customer service problemsInteracts with customers in a timely mannerDemonstrates the ability to elicit information from customers as needed for troubleshooting and general supportDevelop and maintain positive clinical relationships with staff, department representatives and/or equipment usersPossesses knowledge of clinical equipment systems. (laboratory systems, networked medical equipment systems, connected medical equipment etc.)Project Related ResponsibilitiesRequired to travel to multiple hospital and off-site locationsExperience in inventory of equipment and incoming inspectionsAbility to follow network cabling diagrams and documents to build out server cabinets and data racksPossesses knowledge of project management terms and methods

Required

 Qualifications 

Associate’s degree in Science or Technology (BMET/EET) or military trained (BMET) Biomedical Equipment Technician required

Preferred

 1 year of BMET experience


About Us

ABOUT US

At Atlantic Health System, Our Promise To Our Communities Is; Anyone Who Enters One Of Our Facilities, Will Receive The Highest Quality Care Delivered At The Right Time, At The Right Place, And At The Right Cost. This Commitment Is Also Echoed In The Respect, Development And Opportunities We Give To Our More Than 20,000 Team Members. Headquartered In Morristown, New Jersey, We Are One Of The Leading Non-profit Health Care Systems In The Nation. Our Facilities And Sites Of Care Include

Morristown Medical Center, Morristown, NJOverlook Medical Center, Summit, NJNewton Medical Center, Newton, NJChilton Medical Center, Pompton Plains, NJHackettstown Medical Center, Hackettstown, NJGoryeb Children's Hospital, Morristown, NJCentraState Healthcare System, Freehold, NJAtlantic Home Care and HospiceAtlantic Mobile HealthAtlantic Rehabilitation


We also have more than 900 community-based healthcare providers affiliated through Atlantic Medical Group. Atlantic Accountable Care Organization is one of the largest ACOs in the nation, and we are a member of AllSpire Health Partners.

We Have Received Awards And Recognition For The Services We Have Provided To Our Patients, Team Members And Communities. Below Are Just a Few Of Our Accolades

100 Best Companies to Work For ® and FORTUNE® magazine for 15 years Best Places to Work in Healthcare - Modern Healthcare150 Top Places to work in Healthcare - Becker's Healthcare100 Accountable Care Organizations to Know - Becker's Hospital ReviewBest Employers for Workers over 50 - AARPGold-Level "Well Workplace": Wellness Council of America (WELCOA)One of the 100 Best Workplaces for “Millennials” Great Place to Work® and FORTUNE® magazineOne of the 20 Best Workplaces in Health Care: Great Place to Work® and FORTUNE® magazineOfficial Health Care Partner of the New York JetsNJ Sustainable Business 


EEO STATEMENT

Atlantic Health System, Inc. is an equal employment opportunity employer and federal contractor or subcontractor and therefore abides by applicable laws to protect applicants and employees from discrimination in hiring, promotion, discharge, pay, fringe benefits, job training, classification, referral, and other aspects of employment, on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity and sexual orientation), national origin, citizenship status, disability, age, genetics, or veteran status.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level

output_json.company_information: Atlantic Health System is a leading non-profit health care system in the nation headquartered in Morristown, New Jersey. It includes facilities such as Morristown Medical Center, Overlook Medical Center, Newton Medical Center, Chilton Medical Center, Hackettstown Medical Center, Goryeb Children's Hospital, CentraState Healthcare System, and Atlantic Home Care and Hospice. Atlantic Health System also has more than 900 community-based healthcare providers affiliated through Atlantic Medical Group. It has received numerous awards for its services, including being named one of the 100 Best Companies to Work For by FORTUNE magazine for 15 years.
